header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 39/2019 (Akshya Ashok Bhise Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000234-2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Sagar Ashok Shende, suspecting applicant's involvement in the crime.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

argumentSentences.text: 2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4.

arguments.text: 3) It is contended that, the contents of FIR are altogether false and filed with ulterior motive to harass the applicant, applicant is permanent resident on the given address and he is innocent. It is further contended that, he undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3) It is contended that, the contents of FIR are altogether false and filed with ulterior motive to harass the applicant, applicant is permanent resident on the given address and he is innocent.
It is further contended that, he undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail.

arguments.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent person, having no connection with this alleged offence and he falsely involved by this complaint. It is further argued that, applicant is reputed in society and if he is arrested his family will be spoiled. Applicant has no criminal background, he will co­ operate with the investigation machinery and will abide every condition imposed by the Court.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent person, having no connection with this alleged offence and he falsely involved by this complaint.
It is further argued that, applicant is reputed in society and if he is arrested his family will be spoiled.
Applicant has no criminal background, he will co­ operate with the investigation machinery and will abide every condition imposed by the Court.

arguments.text: 5) Considering the submissions and documents it seems that, the crime is registered against applicant accused and his family members after the assault on applicant's brother who is one of the accused. Papers are reflecting that, he is hospitalized in Satara Diagnostic as he has sustained serious injuries. The contents in FIR are not reflecting commission of serious offence. It seems that, crime against the applicant and his family members is registered as counter blast, therefore, ad­interim pre­arrest bail may be granted to the applicant till filing of the say by prosecution in the application. Hence, the order.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Considering the submissions and documents it seems that, the crime is registered against applicant accused and his family members after the assault on applicant's brother who is one of the accused.
Papers are reflecting that, he is hospitalized in Satara Diagnostic as he has sustained serious injuries.
The contents in FIR are not reflecting commission of serious offence.

It seems that, crime against the applicant and his family members is registered as counter blast, therefore, ad­interim pre­arrest bail may be granted to the applicant till filing of the say by prosecution in the application.

order.text: ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Akshya Ashok Bhise, he be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Sagar Ashok Shende dated 17.01.2019 on his furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand), with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station once in a week preferably on every Tuesday in between 11:00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed.

footer: Notice r/o. 28/1/2019 (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 19th January, 2019 Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 39/2019 (Akshya Ashok Bhise Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000234-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of complaint dated 17.01.2019 filed by Sagar Ashok Shende, suspecting applicant's involvement in the crime. 
---background-ends---
2) Alongwith said pre­arrest bail application, the applicant has also preferred ad­interim pre­arrest bail application at Exh. 4. 
---argument-ends---
3) It is contended that, the contents of FIR are altogether false and filed with ulterior motive to harass the applicant, applicant is permanent resident on the given address and he is innocent. It is further contended that, he undertakes to make himself available for interrogation by police as and when required, hence, prayed for interim pre­arrest bail. 
---argument-ends---
4) Advocate for applicant argued that, applicant is innocent person, having no connection with this alleged offence and he falsely involved by this complaint. It is further argued that, applicant is reputed in society and if he is arrested his family will be spoiled. Applicant has no criminal background, he will co­ operate with the investigation machinery and will abide every condition imposed by the Court. 
---argument-ends---
5) Considering the submissions and documents it seems that, the crime is registered against applicant accused and his family members after the assault on applicant's brother who is one of the accused. Papers are reflecting that, he is hospitalized in Satara Diagnostic as he has sustained serious injuries. The contents in FIR are not reflecting commission of serious offence. It seems that, crime against the applicant and his family members is registered as counter blast, therefore, ad­interim pre­arrest bail may be granted to the applicant till filing of the say by prosecution in the application. Hence, the order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Application Exh. 4 is granted. 2) In the event of arrest of applicant Akshya Ashok Bhise, he be released on interim pre­arrest bail, in respect of the complaint filed by Sagar Ashok Shende dated 17.01.2019 on his furnishing personal bond of Rs. 25,000/­ (Rs. Twenty Five Thousand), with one or more surety/ies, till filing of say by prosecution/I.O. on following terms & conditions : a) Applicant shall attend the concern police station once in a week preferably on every Tuesday in between 11:00 a.m. to 1.00 p.m. b) Applicant shall not directly or indirectly make any inducement, threat or promise to any person acquainted with the facts of the case so as to dissuade them from disclosing such facts to the court or to any Police Officer. c) Applicant shall make available himself and co­operate for interrogation by Police Officer as and when required and shall co­operate in the investigation of the present C.R. d) Applicant shall not tamper any of the documents connected to the present C.R. under investigation. e) Applicant shall also produce the documents called by the I.O. during the course of his investigation. f) Issue notice to Public Prosecutor as to why interim pre­arrest bail granted to the applicants shall not be confirmed. 
---order-ends---
Notice r/o. 28/1/2019 (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 19th January, 2019 Satara
